page.title: 01Principal Features
page.content: The two principal features of this area are Forest and Farmland. The {Forest},which is called Montreathmont Forest(pronounced Mon-tri-mond),extends to 1005 hectares and it has 1608000 trees (approx.). However,only 307 hectares are in this designated area. The forest is ministered by the Forestry Commission and the oldest trees were planted in 1936.There has been a change in recent years, because of the interest in Ecology, and the incidence of disease, and the Commission now plant different kinds of trees in each section_ a mixture of Pine, Larch, Sitka Spruce and Norway Spruce. Included are also other trees such as Birch and Sycamore. The Commission has a history of co_operation with other organizations.
